items.artefact_darklevels_1_description: Uncanny figure of a rat-headed woman
items.artefact_doom_1_description: Unnerving piece of black rock. Something is etched on it in an unfamiliar language.
items.artefact_doom_2_description: Heavy key with a demonic eel-like ornament so intricately carved it feels almost alive. Strangely cold to the touch.
items.artefact_doom_3_description: Fragile, yellow and light pink shell that must have been looted from a museum.
items.artefact_doom_4_description: Bold political leaflet printed on thick paper urging residents of the 'sewers' to rebel against segregation.
items.artefact_doom_5_description: Complicated astrological map with calculations indicating an event occurring on year 783.
items.artefact_doom_6_description: Small statue made of metal wire portaying something different to everyone who looks at it
items.artefact_doom_7_description: Small but intricate metallic locust, swarms of which used to attack settlements and devour their resources
items.artefact_fall_1_description: Hand-copied poster describing a loved one missing since The Fall.
items.artefact_ground_1_description: Puzzling piece of stone with an ancient rune on it.
items.artefact_ground_2_description: Seeds are said to contain life itself. These do not grow in the dark City.
items.artefact_ground_3_description: Smooth stone that fits in the palm of a hand. There is something calming about it.
items.artefact_ground_4_description: Small leather pouch with a string that allows it to be worn around the neck. All it contains is some kind of a powder.
items.artefact_history_1_description: Long since dried and useless as a writing implement, but popular among sages as a symbol of knowledge.
items.artefact_history_2_description: Metal ornament depicting a volcano, a mountain that spits fire from the ever-moving heart of the planet.
items.artefact_history_3_description: An old circular data storage with the word 'backup' written on it. Without a working computer, it's impossible to say if it is still readable.
items.artefact_history_4_description: An old worn toy, surprisingly light, with a strange warm texture, from a time when wood wasn't a luxury.
items.artefact_history_5_description: A torn government leaflet promoting the benefits of starting a family, aimed in particular toward women.
items.artefact_rescue_1_description: This is definitely Sunita's. It has the GIGA logo but it has been modified to better fit her water bottle.
items.artefact_surface_1_description: Leftovers from a bygone time. They say there used to be fish tanks, somewhere near the surface.
items.artefact_surface_2_description: Chips like these used to be placed under people's skins, giving them certain powers. It probably doesn't work anymore.
items.artefact_surface_3_description: Worn but still mostly legible, this notebook seems to contain calculations related to fuel consumption of some kind of a large and complex vehicle over very long distances.
items.artefact_surface_4_description: Thin rectangular piece of white plastic which used to open doors. Some believe it still holds great power.
items.artefact_surface_5_description: A worn out but still colorful magazine filled with fantastic stories.
items.artefact_surface_6_description: Once a symbol of the surface life, now a strange lifeless helmet.
items.artefact_surface_7_description: Colorful and nostalgic character from a video game
items.bag_0_description: It's not fancy or durable, but allows one to carry around more stuff than their hands and pockets can hold.
items.bag_1_description: A more spacious bag with lots of pockets.
items.bag_2_description: A huge backpack with plenty of space.
items.bag_3_description: With this bag, weight is starting to be more of a problem than space.
items.bag_4_description: A practical backpack with lots of pockets.
items.bag_5_description: Mechanical chest that automatically follows its owner around. No more worrying about carrying all that stuff yourself.
items.cache_evidence_11_description: A scientific book that might provide clues to some old technologies.
items.cache_evidence_12_description: A scientific book that might provide clues to some forgotten technologies.
items.cache_evidence_13_description: A scientific book that might provide clues to some lost technologies.
items.cache_evidence_21_description: An old story still in somewhat readable condition.
items.cache_evidence_22_description: An old novel still in somewhat readable condition.
items.cache_evidence_23_description: An old novel still in somewhat readable condition.
items.cache_evidence_31_description: An old history book that might contain clues about the past.
items.cache_evidence_32_description: An old history book that might contain clues about the past.
items.cache_evidence_33_description: An old history book that might contain clues about the recent past.
items.cache_evidence_41_description: A technical book describing how things work - or used to work.
items.cache_evidence_42_description: A technical book describing how things work - or used to work.
items.cache_evidence_43_description: A technical book describing old cutting edge technology.
items.cache_food_1_description: Old emergency rations, stamped by the Government. Probably still edible.
items.cache_food_2_description: Government-stamped standardized food pack, except you've never seen one before the Fall.
items.cache_hope_11_description: Old seeds of an extinct or rare plant. Might still grow if planted at a temple.
items.cache_hope_12_description: Well-preserved seeds of an extinct or rare plant. Might grow if planted at a temple.
items.cache_insight_11_description: Summary by a scientist working just before the Fall
items.cache_insight_21_description: Paper by a scientist working just before the Fall
items.cache_metal_1_description: Useless without power, but can be taken apart for some scrap metal
items.cache_metal_2_description: Broken, but can be taken apart for some scrap metal
items.cache_metal_3_description: Can be taken apart for some scrap metal
items.cache_metal_4_description: Can be taken apart for some scrap metal
items.cache_robots_1_description: An old worker robot that might still be repairable.
items.cache_rumours_11_description: A dated newspaper printed in Old Waterworks on recycled rag paper
items.cache_rumours_12_description: A fairly recent newspaper printed in Old Waterworks on recycled rag paper
items.cache_rumours_22_description: A dated newspaper printed in Highgate on some kind of leather
items.cache_rumours_23_description: A fairly recent newspaper printed in Highgate some kind of leather
items.cache_water_1_description: A big package of juice boxes. Might still be good to drink.
items.cache_water_2_description: Government-stamped standardized water ration, except you never saw one of these before the Fall.
items.clothing_hands_1_description: Nothing keeps hands warm like fluffy mittens.
items.clothing_hands_12_description: Not only warm but also protective.
items.clothing_hands_25_description: Good gloves make scavenging much safer.
items.clothing_hands_3_description: Well-made gloves with the logo of the Agricorp.
items.clothing_hands_4_description: Gloves that protect from almost all environmental hazards.
items.clothing_hands_5_description: Gloves made from recycled advanced textiles from before the Fall.
items.clothing_head_0_description: If there was any sunlight, these would probably be handy.
items.clothing_head_1_description: An old hat from synthetic wool.
items.clothing_head_2_description: Meager protection against the effects of polluted air.
items.clothing_head_25_description: A bit clumsy, but quite useful in a fight.
items.clothing_head_27_description: Protects the head from blows and the wind.
items.clothing_head_3_description: Perfect apparel for the post-apocalyptic adventurer.
items.clothing_head_4_description: Gives a definite sense of security in dangerous environments.
items.clothing_head_45_description: A practical, protective hood that doesn't get in the way.
items.clothing_head_5_description: Newly crafted headgear designed specifically for scavenging in the post-Fall City.
items.clothing_head_l14_description: Offers reasonable protection from environmental hazards.
items.clothing_lower_1_description: Barely counts for clothing, but for now it'll have to do.
items.clothing_lower_2_description: Used to be the standard uniform in the dark levels of the City.
items.clothing_lower_3_description: Looks official, but not particularly protective.
items.clothing_lower_5_description: Nothing keeps you warm like long underwear.
items.clothing_over_2_description: Doesn't make one invincible, but feels like it.
items.clothing_over_25_description: Something that's actually produced with the aim of keeping one safe.
items.clothing_over_25x_description: Something that's actually produced with the aim of keeping one safe.
items.clothing_over_3_description: An ugly but surprisingly comfortable metal blanket
items.clothing_over_45_description: Novel technology for maximal survival in the post-Fall City
items.clothing_over_5_description: Based on the old Surface Guard uniform with additional environmental proection.
items.clothing_over_6_description: Futuristic armour designed for those exploring the world outside the City's protective walls.
items.clothing_over_l14_description: Effective protection against radiation, but clumsy to move around in.
items.clothing_over_w_description: Solid warm outerwear that keeps both wind and chill out.
items.clothing_upper_1_description: Barely counts for clothing, but for now it'll have to do.
items.clothing_upper_2_description: Feels oddly comfortable in dark corridors and abandoned factories.
items.clothing_upper_3_description: Looks official, but not particularly protective.
items.clothing_upper_35_description: Shirt made from recycled advanced textiles used before the Fall.
items.clothing_upper_4_description: Specifically made for keeping travellers warm and safe.
items.clothing_upper_5_description: The best protection an explorer can hope for.
items.consumable_graffiti_01_description: Bottle containing paint. Can be used to make graffiti.
items.consumable_map_1_description: A piece of cardboard with roughly drawn map of the area
items.consumable_map_2_description: A piece of paper that seems to be part of a bigger map
items.consumable_map_explorer_description: Map sketched by an explorer based on their knowledge of the City.
items.consumable_weapon_1_description: One-use weapon that deals some damage to any enemy.
items.consumable_weapon_bio_description: One-use weapon that slows down an organic enemy.
items.consumable_weapon_mechanical_description: One-use weapon that stuns a mechanical enemy.
items.document_description: Some interesting documents found while exploring
items.document_story_expedition_diary_01_descr: Amanda Ettler's diary from the failed Surface Expedition
items.document_story_expedition_leaflet_01_des: Leaflet calling for volunteers for an expedition.
items.equipment_map_2_description: Adds more detail to the map
items.exploration_1_description: Useful tool when exploring and scouting.
items.exploration_2_description: Makes resting outside more effective (but not safer)
items.exploration_3_description: You are not sure if it works, but it doesn't weigh much
items.first_aid_kit_1_description: Heal light injuries on the go.
items.first_aid_kit_1_official_description: Mass-produced first aid kit from before the Fall
items.first_aid_kit_2_description: Heal all injuries on the go.
items.first_aid_kit_2_exodus_description: Government-stamped standardized emergency kit, except you've never seen one before the Fall.
items.flee_1_description: Can be used to escape a fight.
items.glowstick_1_description: Temporary light. Can be used as a distraction.
items.light1_description: Feeble light for basic survival in the dark levels.
items.light2_description: Steady and reliable source of light.
items.light3_description: They say the ghost light can show you more the darker places you go.
items.robot_1_description: Old bot that could perhaps be repaired.
items.shoe_1_description: Minimal protection, but better than going barefoot in the debris.
items.shoe_2_description: Decent shoes for walking in most places.
items.shoe_3_description: Good shoes like these can make travelling much easier.
items.shoe_4_description: The comfiest shoes you've ever had.
items.shoe_l14_description: Protection from environmental hazards. And snakes.
items.trade_1_description: A beautiful orb said to have formed in the Sea, a massive body of water that is the origin of all life. Traders would be interested in it.
items.trade_2_description: Delicious sweet well-preserved from before the Fall. Now too precious to consume. Traders would be interested in it.
items.trade_3_description: A jar of honey produced by bees in artifical greenhouses, too rare to consume these days. Traders would be interested in it.
items.trade_4_description: A precious gem. Traders would be interested in it.
items.trade_5_description: Artfully assembled self-sustaining little garden, reminding you of public parks
items.weapon12_description: A bit sturdier than the shiv.
items.weapon13_description: More a status symbol than a weapon
items.weapon14_description: Simple and sturdy weapon, easy to use
items.weapon4_description: A crude single-shot pistol, like a hand-held miniature cannon.
items.weapon5_description: A more sophisticated handgun that allows several shots before reloading.
items.weapon52_description: A formidable axe specifically designed for combat
items.weapon6_description: It may be made from scrap metal but it is still a serious weapon.
items.weapon7_description: Powerful but heavy and somewhat unreliable construction of pipes, reclaimed weapon parts and improvised ammunition.
items.weapon8_description: Deadly weapon similar to those that were mass-produced just before the Fall.

dialogue.character_bard_default_event_01_p1: I go from settlement to settlement and play music. I will play at the inn tonight.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_02_p1: Music used to be everywhere. Now it is a kind of magic again.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Tem?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p2: Tem was a gardener. When the Fall shut down his greenhouse, his colleagues fled, but he stayed.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p3: He kept the plants alive through music. In the darkness, he grew amazing things.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_03_p4: One day, passing raiders tore it all down. They took Tem's Drum, and the last Greenhouse in the City died. Nobody knows what happened to Tem.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p1: Would you like to hear the story of the Governor?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p2: The Governor, as you know, ruled the City for decades before The Fall. Under his vision, many new levels were built in the City. He was well over 100 years old, and nodoby could imagine the City without him.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p3: In his youth he fought for old Dictatorship against the rebels. He was one of the last soldiers to desert the Blue Army.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_04_p4: Nobody knows what happened to him during the Fall. Perhaps he is immortal, and will come back again?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Maren Eze?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p2: Maren Eze was a fashion was an executive for Redflame, back then a luxury brand. On her orders, a waste storage facility was built in her native Sahel, outside of the City.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p3: She knew the facility was not safe. But it looked very good on their marketing material, and much of the world outside the City was already turning into a wasteland.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_05_p4: Eze was able to evacuate most of her family from Sahel to the City, but most of the locals never had a chance.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Erxin?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p2: Erxin grew up in the Slums, in District 47. But he had a talent for knockball, and rose to to omnurban wealth and fame.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p3: To pay respects to his roots, he had a grand stadium built in District 47.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_06_p4: On the opening day of the stadium, there were so many people there to see their beloved Erxin, that the crowd turned into a crush and hundreds died. Erxin was never seen in public again.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p1: Would you like to hear the story of Rudolf Grl?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p2: Rudplf Grl was originally a Runner, a small time gangster hunting for valuables in the Dark Levels and selling them to the people on the Surface.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p3: He founded his own little gang, called the Red Hats. This threatened the Hansa gang, and lead to a bloody war in the Slums.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_07_p4: Eventually, Grl among many others involved were imprisoned. But the rumour has it that he escaped, just a few months before The Fall.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_08_p1: I've heard of several settlements destroyed by earthquakes since the Fall. Do you think the City is somehow shutting down since the Fall?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_09_p1: For centuries, people from all over the world flocked to the City. Nobody ever left. Nobody we heard back from anyway.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_10_p1: Do you want to hear the story of Amanda Ettler?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_10_p2: Amanda Ettler was a great explorer who arranged several privately funded expeditions to the dark and abandoned levels of the City, and also a few short ones to the outside.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_10_p3: Among other historical sites, she rediscovered Old Citta, the Etrurian City State from before the war, which became a huge tourist attraction.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_10_p4: Some say she is still alive and continuing her work. Some even say she will lead an group of people out of the City to start a new life somewhere else.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_11_p1: Do you want to hear the story of the founding of the City?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_11_p2: The City was originally called Hwesia, and it was one of three major cities in the world that begun to grow so big they started building in layers.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_11_p3: Hwesia started a City Council which was a combination of several governments within its urban area. It was originally a utopian project, but over time morphed into an iron dictatorship.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_11_p4: The Dictatorship fell in a brutal civil war, and after a period of fractured states, the Government as we know it rose from its ashes.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_12_p1: Do wou want to hear the story of Giga?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_12_p2: Giga, or Pylon, was the mining and construction megacorporation. Giga was the operations and Pylon was the consumer facing energy company. They grew rich from the City's rapid expansion, and controlled most of mining, construction, transport and energy.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_12_p3: It was almost like a society within society. Workers at Giga were fiercely loyal to it, even though their working conditions were often terrible. They felt they built and owned the city and the Government just ran the show on the Surface.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_12_p4: Many survived the Fall, since their work was in the lower levels, away from the chaos.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_13_p1: Do you want to hear the story of Futurefields?
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_13_p2: Futurefields was the megacorporation controlling agriculture. It maintained greenhouses, fish farms, synthfarms and storages across the City.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_13_p3: It was known to use cutting edge technology, but there were also rumours of shamatic rituals that were considered part of keeping the farms running.
dialogue.character_bard_default_event_13_p4: Its operations mostly collapsed after the Fall and loss of power, but there are rumours of communities surviving on isolated farms.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_01_p1: People need more than just survival.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_02_p1: A bard is usually welcome in any settlement.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_03_p1: Oh, I've never met anyone who's been outside. Only heard legends.
dialogue.character_bard_default_meet_04_p1: I believe in magic. But I think people make it, not some magic spirits.
dialogue.character_beggar_default_meet_01_p1: Could you spare a little food for a lone wanderer?
dialogue.character_beggar_default_meet_02_p1: I lost everything in the Fall.
dialogue.character_beggar_default_meet_04_p1: The slums weren't hit so bad by the Fall, directly. But when the flood of refugees came, things got messy.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_01_p1: If you can find enough rubber you could make equipment to explore polluted areas.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_02_p1: You can never have too many hairpins.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_03_accep: Thank you. Hope these prove useful.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_03_p1: Would you like some crafting ingredients? I could trade some for supplies.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_04_p1: For a fee, I can improve your weapon.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_event_05_p1: For a fee, I can improve your equipment.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_01_p1: I am looking for crafting ingredients.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_02_p1: Fixing old things has become a valuable skill.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_upgrade_c: Here you go. May it help you on your journey.
For a fee, I can improve a piece of your equipment.
dialogue.character_crafter_default_meet_upgrade_w: Here you go. May it help you on your journey.
For a fee, I can improve your weapon.
dialogue.character_darkDweller_default_interact_0: I am not used to being around so many people.
I believe the Fall was caused by us losing touch with nature and the world outside the City.
Most old greenhouses are on the edges of the City, with access to sunlight.
Perhaps we can build a settlement on the Surface.
The old Government never held much sway in the Dark Levels anyway.
Humans built the City, but other creatures have made their home here too.
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_event_01_p1: We should never have left the Ground!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_event_03_p1: The City will consume us all!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_event_04_p1: No matter how high we build we cannot escape the wrath of gods!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_meet_01_p1: The City will claim us all! Repent!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_meet_02_p1: This is the end! Humanity's time is ending!
dialogue.character_doomsayer_default_meet_04_p1: We thought we can isolate ourselves from the cycle of life itself, but it was an illusion! Death returns! With vengeance!
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_01_p1: Can I trade some of this junk for water?
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_02_p1: I have no use for this, you can have it.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_03_p1: I have not seen anyone of that description, but I'll keep my eyes peeled for you and let you know if I see her.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_04_p1: I don't know if you just notice them more now that the lights are off, but it does feel like the earhquakes have been getting worse.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_05_p1: I think if you want to fix the Greenhouses, you need to find out what happened to Tem.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_06_p1: Before the Fall, all food and medicine was grown in the Greenhouses.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_07_p1: Hmm, a way out of the City? I never thought about it. Maybe through the Ground?
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_08_p1: Not many who were anywhere near the Surface when the Fall happened survived.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_event_09_p1: I am not sure humans can survive outside of the City anymore.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_01_p1: I make do with what I find out in the City.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_03_p1: Some levels are too polluted to live permanently on.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_04_p1: The City is hostile, but according to rumours the outside even more so.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_05_p1: It's easy to imagine seeing things when alone in the dark. You just need to focus on where you're going.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_06_p1: I hear things out in the City. Steps. Always behind me.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_07_p1: The City is big, but it has its edges. In some places, you can reach them and look outside. Sometimes, you can see the sea far, far below.
dialogue.character_drifter_default_meet_08_p1: I have some extra water, have some. Pay it forward some day.
dialogue.character_fortuneTeller_default_event_02: This is a very charming settlement.
dialogue.character_fortuneTeller_default_fortune_: You will lose a friend, and then meet them again.
Little by little, one travels far. Do not give up hope.
You will leave this City one day. But not the way you think.
You will return to where you came from one day.
You will discover a great power. But it will not be you who uses it.
People will tell you that you cannot reach your goals, but you will prove them wrong.
You will be a leader. Do not wait for others to show the way.
Many people will ask you for help. Help them, and they will help you on your quest.
You will travel further than you ever imagined.
You will have to make difficult decisions. Do not flinch.
You must face a dark and ancient danger. You cannot defeat it. You must flee from it.
dialogue.character_fortuneTeller_default_intro_01: Do you dare to ask the spirits about your destiny? For a fee, I will tell you about your future.
dialogue.character_fortuneTeller_default_intro_02: You have a special aura. Would you like me to read your fortune?
dialogue.character_fortuneTeller_default_meet_03_: Do not gaze too deep into the shadows.
dialogue.character_fortuneTeller_default_meet_04_: May your step be sure and your plunder rich.
dialogue.character_fortuneTeller_default_skip_01_: Find me again if you change your mind.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_block: There is some debris blocking the way to the {direction} of here.
There are some pretty unstable looking old explosives blocking the way to the {direction} of here.
There is an impassable gap to the {direction} of here.
There is a toll gate to the {direction} of here. What makes them think they can charge people for passage?
There is some industrial waste to the {direction} of here that blocks passage.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_campa: There is a safe sector for a camp to the {direction}.
If you're looking for a place to camp, go {direction}.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_hazar: The area {direction} of here is very cold.
There is an area full of debris {direction} of here. It's difficult to pass through.
There is a flooded area {direction} of here. It's not easy to pass through.
There is a polluted area {direction} of here. You'll need good equipment.
There is an area with radiation {direction} of here. Be careful.
There is an area {direction} of here that is gang territory. I would be careful about going there.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_ingre: There's a good spot for scavenging ingredients not too far to the {direction} of here.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_passa: There is an old emergency passage to the {direction} of here. Not sure if it's still usable though.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_settl: There is a settlement on this level called {name}.
dialogue.character_generic_helpful_meet_poi_water: There is a {name} to the {direction}, not far from here.
If you're looking for water, just go {direction}.
dialogue.character_generic_reserved_meet_02_p1: It's hard to keep track of time in the darkness.
dialogue.character_generic_story_explain_ground_0: I've heard that somewhere many levels down the City rests directly on the planet's surface.
How many levels down is the Ground? I have no idea.
Why do you want to reach the Ground? It was abadoned decades ago. It's probably covered in jungle and really dangerous.
I wish I could leave the City too.
The City started on the Ground, and then gradually grew upwards. The highest levels and most recently built levels are called the Surface.
I heard that at the very bottom of the City the floor is made of dirt and water and there are plants everywhere. Sounds unsanitary to be honest.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_dunno_01_p1: You are investigating the Fall? I don't know where I would even start. I guess you would need to find some survivors.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_dunno_02_p1: You are investigating the Fall? I heard the Government had some secret facilities in the Dark Levels, maybe they have clues.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_dunno_03_p1: You are investigating the Fall? I think you should go to the Surface and try to find the epicenter.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_encourage_0: It's good someone is trying to figure out what really happened. There's so many rumours.
I'm glad someone is investigating the Fall. What if whatever caused it could happen again?
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_alie: I heard that the Fall was an attack by aliens. They are probably settling on the Surface now.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_city: I fear the City itself has gone rogue and the Fall was just the beginning.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_gove: I think the Government caused the Fall. They were losing control and took us all down with them.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_hack: The Fall could have been caused by a group of hackers. They probably tried to take over the Network.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_hurr: I heard that hurricanes could cause destruction like The Fall. Perhaps it is safer to live closer to the Ground.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_spir: I think the Fall was a pressure wave created by the spirits of all those who died so the City could be built.
dialogue.character_generic_story_fall_theory_terr: The Fall was a terrorist attack. I heard it from someone who was there.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_cult_: The Governor will come back and save everyone.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_neg2p: I used to think it was cool to criticise the Government but I miss it now. The old slums were much better than what we have now.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_negat: The old Government was a dictatorship in disguise, and we're better off without it.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_pos2n: I used to work for the Govenrment and thought it was the only thing keeping humanity together. But we're doing fine without it.
dialogue.character_generic_story_government_posit: The old Government built the best parts of the City and kept everything running.
dialogue.character_generic_story_l14_01_p1: You are a Surfacer. How did you make it down past Level 14?
dialogue.character_generic_story_searching_for_gr: Sorry, I haven't seen any Greenhouses.
I heard Greenhouses were often located on the edge of the City, where you have better access to sunlight.
dialogue.character_generic_story_surface_01_p1: The Surface is on level {surfaceLevel}. Or used to be at least. Not sure how much is left of it.
dialogue.character_generic_story_warn_ground_01_p: I doubt it is possible to live outside the City.
dialogue.character_generic_story_warn_ground_02_p: I came to the City as a child as a refugee from the outside. I don't remember much, except constant boiling of water and over-cooked food.
dialogue.character_generic_story_warn_ground_03_p: I've been exploring the Ground for awhile but I haven't found an end to the City. I don't know where an exit would be.
dialogue.character_generic_stranded_meet_directio: Thank you. I will go there and try to make myself useful.
Where is your settlement? Can I join you?
Oh. I understand. I will find another place.
dialogue.character_generic_stranded_meet_water_p1: I've ran out of water. Can you spare some?
Thank you, stranger. I am sure your good deed will come around.
The Fall has made wolves of us all.
dialogue.character_generic_world_level_numbers_01: The levels are numbered from the Surface down, so the Surface is Level {surfaceLevel}, the level below it is Level {surfaceLevelMinus1} and so on. The Ground is uneven, so it is at different levels in different parts of the City.
dialogue.character_guard_default_meet_01_p1: This building is none of your business.
dialogue.character_guard_default_meet_02_p1: I'm paid to make sure nobody enters the maglev tracks and that's what I do.
dialogue.character_guard_default_meet_03_p1: I'm worried the Fall was the end and now we're just living on borrowed time.
dialogue.character_guard_default_meet_04_p1: I wouldn't wander too far {direction} of here. Pollution.
dialogue.character_guard_default_meet_05_p1: I wouldn't wander too far {direction} of here. Radiation.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_01_p1: Cockroaches are perfectly edible, but rats are tastier.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_02_p1: Watch out for the spiders, the grow big in the darkness.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_03_p1: Everything in the City is either flesh or blood, or machine. If it's flesh and blood, it can be killed.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_04_p1: I heard about the Surface Expedition. I hope they find out what happened.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_05_p1: I stopped thinking about the past and the future. In here there's just now.
dialogue.character_hunter_default_meet_06_p1: Do you need some food? I have plenty. Here, take some.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_01_p1: Mercenary is a steady living in times like these.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_02_p1: I used to be a guard at a shopping mall.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_03_p1: People get superstitious in times like these. There are no ghosts or spirits here. For better or worse, it's just us humans.
dialogue.character_mercenary_default_meet_04_p1: The Red Hats were a gang associated with the Hansa. I didn't know they still existed though.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_01_p1: I deliver messages from one settlement to another.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_02_p1: There are secret passages between Levels but I will not tell you about them.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_03_p1: Sectors closer to the middle of a district are generally safer.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_04_p1: I heard of a settlement that was completely wiped out by disease.
dialogue.character_messenger_default_meet_05_p1: I hear the Surface Expedition took off. It was about fifteen people including the leader, Amanda Ettler. I don't think we heard back from them yet.
dialogue.character_scavenger_default_meet_01_p1: There is still treasure to be found in these corridors.
dialogue.character_scavenger_default_meet_02_p1: This looks like a good area for some scavenging.
dialogue.character_scavenger_default_meet_03_p1: You know how somtimes it becomes completely quiet for a few minutes or hours? The humming of the City just stops? I think those are power outages.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_01_p1: There is a change going on the City. The Fall was just the beginning.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_02_p1: I heard you want to revive the Greenhouses.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_03_p1: If you want to revive the Greenhouses, you need help from the spirits.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_04_p1: I visited your temple, it was quite pleasant. I think you would like this.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_event_05_p1: Spirits of the City are not the only supernatural forces on this planet. The earthquakes are caused by angry spirits.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_01_p1: Old magic survives and it will save us all.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_02_p1: These places have memories, and not all of them are friendly.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_03_p1: There are magical places and items left hidden in the dark corners of the City.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_04_p1: The Ground holds special power us all. It is the foundation of the City in more sense than one.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_05_p1: If you stay alone in the dark for awhile, and listen, you can hear the people who used to live here.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_blessing_p: If you want, I can cast a small protective spell on you.
dialogue.character_shaman_default_meet_blessing_r: Very well, may your own determination guide you well.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_interact_0: I used to love the Dark Levels. I never thought I'd live here permanently though.
I heard that the Fall was caused by a meteorite.
We don't have to rebuild things the way they were, we can build something new.
I never knew there were people still living in the Dark Levels. Before the Fall I mean.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_01_p1: I am used to the darkness, but I can't get used to the quiet.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_02_p1: I've come such a long way, I will make it out.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_03_p1: Level 14 is almost impassable. It was bad already before the Fall but some containment seems to have failed since then.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_04_p1: How long has it been since The Fall? Weeks? Years? I've completely lost my sense of time.
dialogue.character_slumRefugee_default_meet_05_p1: First we lost power. The the refugees came. We ran out of food. I became a refugee too.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_interac: Together we can rebuild and rise again.
They say The Fall was a big explosion. I wonder what happened.
I want to know what really caused The Fall.
Will everything ever go back to normal again?
I wonder what happened to the Governor.
I heard there is a huge crater on the Surface.
The Sundome was destroyed in the Fall. It's dangerous on the Surface now.
I feel like the world before the Fall is so far away, like a dream.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_01: My parents are still near the Surface.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_02: I am not sure where I'm going.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_03: I don't know what happened, but the Surface is completely destroyed.
dialogue.character_surfaceRefugee_default_meet_04: I am disappointed in the Government. This all happened, and they just.. disappeared.
dialogue.character_trader_default_meet_02_p1: Travelling these parts is risky, but the trade is worth it.
dialogue.character_trader_default_meet_03_p1: My Traveller's Guild Badge protects me against robbers.
dialogue.character_workerApothecary_default_inter: Medicine decreases the chance of disease outbreaks
Old supplies of medicine are fast running out in the City
I don't know what you found there on the Ground, but I am glad we're able to make our own medicine.
dialogue.character_workerChemist_default_interact: Together we can defeat the Fall and rise again.
We are going to need lots of fuel.
dialogue.character_workerCleric_default_interact_: We must find a balance between technology and nature.
My most important duty is the serve the community.
The spirits help us build a stronger community.
The spirits originate from the Ground, but they are present everywhere in the City.
dialogue.character_workerConcrete_default_interac: Rebuilding will take a lot of materials.
The City is mostly made of concrete.
The City was built over decades.
dialogue.character_workerGardener_default_interac: Growing anything in the City is a delicate process.
Before the Fall, agriculture relied on near infinite energy and artificial light.
Plants are not machines. They know if you care about them.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_default_interact: There is much we don't know about the City.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_01_p1: Rumours are vital for figuring out what is going on in the City now that mass communication is dead.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_02_p1: Evidence is knowledge and technology from before. We should save and store it.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_apocaly: I wonder if it would be safer to leave the City before the earthquakes destroy it?
I have faith in us finding a way to survive the earthquakes.
Were there always so many earthquakes in the Dark Levels?
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_disease: There are people that are really ill. We have to find medicine.
I'm afraid that the disease will spread more.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_l15_01_: What is it like on level 15?
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_overcro: There are too many people and too few homes here.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_searchi: Perhaps if we find a Greenhouse, we can make medicine and stop these disease outbreaks.
I'm worried because we don't have access to medicine.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_spirits: I was not religious before, but I am glad we built the shrine.
I don't know if I belive in the spirits.
The Greenhouses are all the proof I need that the spirits are real.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_interact_story_g: I feel much safer now that we can grow herbs in the Greenhouses.
We have to find a way to restore the Greenhouses.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_meet_02_p1: Good to see a familiar face out here.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_story_apocalypse: How will we decide who will be on the space shuttle?
We've built a civilization out of ashes here in the City. We can do it again somewhere else.
I don't want to leave the City.
I can't wait to see outer space.
dialogue.character_workerGeneric_story_escape_bui: I'd like to help repair the staircase you found, but we don't have the technology. Perhaps more exploration would uncover hints for how to do it?
I'd like to help repair the staircase you found. We just need to collect enough materials.
dialogue.character_workerRobotmaker_default_inter: I wonder what happened to my family and friends on the Surface.
Robots used to be much more complex, but we have to start somewhere.
Robots help workers and increase their productivity.
dialogue.character_workerRope_default_interact_01: Textiles have always driven human progress.
dialogue.character_workerRope_default_interact_02: In retrospect, clothes used to be really weird.
dialogue.character_workerRubber_default_interact_: We're lucky we found such a good source of rubber.
I used to work in the mines.
dialogue.character_workerScavenger_default_intera: We are lucky to be alive.
The City will provide us with supplies for decades to come.
Metal is our main building material. We are going to need lots of it.
You can use scrap metal to craft and build all kinds of things.
You can often find specific spots in the City for scavenging crafting ingredients.
Early civilizations had wood, but now it is too scarce to use as a building material or fuel.
dialogue.character_workerScavenger_default_meet_0: I'm out to collect building materials for the camp.
This place is a near infinite source of scap metal.
dialogue.character_workerScientist_default_intera: I am worried about the earthquakes.
We should re-learn as much as possible from the old technologies before the knowledge and remains disappear.
We are figuring out how things we used to take for granted really worked.
I dream of finding a library one day.. but I fear most of our lost knowledge was saved in electronic formats.
I had no idea the earthquakes were this bad. The old Government really dropped the ball on this.
We are trying to figure out if there is some way to reinforce the city or stop the earthquakes, but I am not optimistic.
It is unlikely that life outside the City is possible at this point.
I don't believe in the spirits, but if believing in them makes people happier then that's good.
We need to find a way to build a space shuttle of our own before the earthquakes get too violent.
dialogue.character_workerSoldier_default_interact: There's a lot of hungry people out there that are jealous of everything we have.
I am prepared to defend this community with my life.
First robbers and now ghosts? What are we supposed to do about that?
dialogue.character_workerToolsmith_default_intera: It is satisfying to make useful things with your own hands.
dialogue.character_workerTrapper_default_interact: I never knew there was so much wildlife in the City. Were they all there before the Fall?
I didn't use to think much about where my food came from.
If we run out of food, people will leave.
dialogue.character_workerTrapper_default_meet_01_: I'm out to check the traps.
dialogue.character_workerTrapper_default_meet_02_: I'm out to collect food for the camp.
dialogue.character_workerTrapper_default_meet_03_: Did you run out of food? Here, have some.
dialogue.character_workerWater_default_interact_0: We're lucky the City still collects and filters water.
We throw away any water that tastes or smells funny.
We need food and water in the camp and for expeditions.
dialogue.character_workerWater_default_meet_01_p1: I'm out to collect water for the camp.
dialogue.character_workerWater_default_meet_02_p1: I'm out to inspect the water collectors.
dialogue.character_workerWater_default_meet_03_p1: Did you run out of water? Here, have some.
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_cost_blueprints: I learned to make traps from whatever was handy during my long years alone in the Dark Levels
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_cost_lockpick_o: If you find any locked doors let me have a look
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_cost_scout_outs: I'm keeping notes of any interesting places we find
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_detect_hazards_: I'll keep an eye out for pollution and other hazards
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_detect_ingredie: I'll keep an eye out for crafting ingredients
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_detect_poi_outs: I'll keep an eye out for any interesting buildings
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_detect_supplies: It's dangerous to run out of food or water out here
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_fight_outside_0: Have your weapon handy just in case.
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_flee_outside_01: Always have an escape route in mind in case you get attacked.
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_handler_outside: You need to approach wild animals carefully
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_mapping_outside: Districts like this often follow a fairly predictable pattern
I think I know where we are
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_scavenge_bluepr: We can learn a lot from how the City was set up before
I'll keep an eye out for any useful blueprints
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_scavenge_genera: They'll be impressed by the stuff we bring back in the camp
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_scavenge_ingred: You can find crafting ingredients everywhere if you look
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_scavenge_suppli: Thank the City the water infractructure still works somehow
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_scavenge_valuab: Traders pay good money for items that remind people of the way things used to be
There's all kinds of treasure buried out here
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_stat_evidence_o: The Government left its mark everywhere in the City
We can learn a lot from all the old technology and facilities here
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_stat_hope_outsi: Everywhere there are signs of people surviving, recovering, prospering against the odds
It seems like the Spirits were always worshipped in the City in one form or another
dialogue.explorer_generic_ability_stat_rumours_ou: People have left their mark everywhere in the City
We are learning how to survive in this new world
dialogue.explorer_generic_animal_event_01_p1: The animal stands patiently outside the camp. It looks hungry.
dialogue.explorer_generic_bat_event_01_p1: The bat hangs upside down outside of the light of the campfire, but seems tame.
dialogue.explorer_generic_bat_interact_02_p1: The bat stares at you inquisitively.
dialogue.explorer_generic_bat_interact_03_p1: The bat shifts, and you get the sense that it's ready for adventure.
dialogue.explorer_generic_bat_outside_01_p1: The bat keeps flying off into the darkness but always comes back
dialogue.explorer_generic_bat_outside_02_p1: The bat is settled under an awning while waiting for you to continue
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_interact_03_p1: The dog looks ready for another adventure.
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_interact_04_p1: The dog gives out a happy bark.
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_interact_05_p1: The dog gives your hand a lick.
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_outside_01_p1: The dog stays close to you
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_outside_02_p1: The dog is enthusiastically sniffing every corner and trash pile. You wonder what discoveries it is making.
dialogue.explorer_generic_dog_outside_03_p1: Somehow, the dog has found a stick. It's made of plastic though.
dialogue.explorer_generic_fighter_outside_01_p1: If we run into trouble, just stay close to me
dialogue.explorer_generic_fighter_outside_02_p1: Let's try to not make too much noise
dialogue.explorer_generic_human_outside_01_p1: I feel like some kind of a great explorer out in the City sometimes. Like Amanda Ettler or something.
dialogue.explorer_generic_human_outside_02_p1: I knew the Dark Levels were mostly uninhabited, but I assumed it was more.. storage or infrastructure or something. There's so much old and abandoned stuff here.
dialogue.explorer_generic_human_outside_03_p1: Lead the way, I'll follow you
dialogue.explorer_generic_human_outside_04_p1: Travelling around the City used to be much easier
dialogue.explorer_generic_human_outside_05_p1: I never appreciated a good pair of shoes before
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_01_p1: I'm happy to follow your lead.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_02_p1: I like exploring the City, but it's dangerous alone.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_directions_cen: I would go towards the center of the zone, to the {direction}.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_directions_exp: I think we should explore the area {direction} of here.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_directions_non: I have no idea which way we should go.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_directions_saf: If I had to guess, it's probably safer towards {direction}.
I don't think it will be possible to set up a camp on this level.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_directions_sco: We should go back to scout the buildings we saw {direction} of here.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_injured_outsid: I need to get back to camp to recover.
I'm fine thanks, just need to get this cut checked out when we get back to camp.
I don't feel great. Can we head back to camp?
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_injured_party_: I need to stay back in Camp and rest for a bit.
It's not too bad but I should get this checked out before heading out again.
I'm in no shape to go outside.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_injured_recove: I'll stay back in Camp and rest for a bit.
I'll be back in action in no time.
dialogue.explorer_generic_interact_story_apocalyp: Where can we go if the City is not safe?
I have nightmares about the whole City collapsing due to the earthquakes.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_10_01_: This is our tenth settlement. It really feels like we are rebuilding what was lost.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_11_01_: We are entering the former slums now. I used to live not too far from here. Not sure I could recognize the place anymore though.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_12_01_: Camp number twelve. Are we going all the way to the Surface?
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_13_01_: We are getting into the areas of the City that were prosperous before the Fall. But everything has been looted by now.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_14_01_: We are getting close to the Surface now. Do you think it will be possible to build a settlement there?
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_15_01_: The Surface. Used to be where everyone dreamed of living one day, now just a barren wasteland.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_3_01_p: I was getting worried we'll never find another safe spot to camp.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_4_01_p: Fourth camp. This little tribe is spreading across the City.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_5_01_p: We are getting into the deep levels of the City. If any secret Government facilities survive, some are likely here.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_6_01_p: We are getting closer to the Ground.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_7_01_p: Another camp. Do you think we will find people who want to join us this far down?
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_8_01_p: This area of the City is ancient. It's quite exciting to reclaim it and built something new here.
dialogue.explorer_generic_intract_new_camp_9_01_p: We are now entering more populated levels. This camp is going to have to compete with the gangs for survival.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_event_01_p1: It's not safe to wander around alone here
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_01_p: Seen some strange creatures out there.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_02_p: Do you think there's anyone left alive outside the City?
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_03_p: I don't miss the past. Now everyone is the architect of their own fortune.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_04_p: Do you think the rumours are true? That there are ghosts in the Dark Levels.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_05_p: I did what I had to do to survive after the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_interact_06_p: I'm not surprised if some of the old Slum gangs survived The Fall.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mercenary_meet_01_p1: Do you actually know how to use that weapon?
dialogue.explorer_generic_mule_event_01_p1: The mule is skittish, but refuses to go away.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mule_interact_02_p1: The mule lets you pet it.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mule_interact_03_p1: The mule rests its head against you.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mule_meet_01_p1: The mule is skittish, but seems intent on following you.
dialogue.explorer_generic_mule_outside_01_p1: The mule walks confidently through the jumbled streets
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_event_01_p1: There is a huge olm hiding under a storage building.
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_interact_01_p1: The olm waits under a building.
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_interact_02_p1: The olm's skin is cold and soft. It does not seem to like being touched.
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_interact_03_p1: The olm runs around you excitedly.
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_interact_04_p1: It's hard to say for sure, but the olm looks content.
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_meet_01_p1: There is a huge olm that looks curious about you.
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_outside_01_p1: The olm keeps slinking off under things. You are not sure if it's afraid, or curious.
dialogue.explorer_generic_olm_outside_02_p1: The olm seems very happy in the watery environment.
dialogue.explorer_generic_raven_event_01_p1: The huge bird flutters from one fence to another on the edge of the camp, but doesn't go away.
dialogue.explorer_generic_raven_interact_01_p1: The raven looks at you from a distance.
dialogue.explorer_generic_raven_interact_02_p1: The raven is perched on a windowsill and looks comfortable.
dialogue.explorer_generic_raven_interact_03_p1: The raven jumps on your arm and cocks its head inquisitively.
dialogue.explorer_generic_raven_interact_04_p1: The raven flaps its wings, happy to see you.
dialogue.explorer_generic_raven_meet_01_p1: The huge bird sits nearby, and looks straight at you.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_event_01_p1: I'm pretty good at finding the good stuff.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_01_p: Canned food will stay good for another several decades.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_02_p: Sometimes scavenging in these levels feels more like archeology.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_03_p: I'm lucky that I'm in good health.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_04_p: If the City runs out of emergency power, I wonder if it will get cold here in the City.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_05_p: These levels were mostly abandoned long before the Fall. Why did we keep building new ones?
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_interact_06_p: I don't feel bad about taking dead people's stuff.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_meet_01_p1: Good meeting another human being out here.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scavenger_outside_01_p1: I hope we find some good stuff this run
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_event_01_p1: I can help you find passage through the City.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_01_p1: I'm so used to the darkness now, I can't imagine what the City would look with the lights on.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_02_p1: I hope to see the Ground one day.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_03_p1: I used to run odd jobs for the Black Societies but I after the Fall I just left.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_04_p1: You have to be careful when out in the City. It's easy to get hurt in the rubble.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_05_p1: Exploring the Dark Levels is like unearthing the history of the City one level at a time.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_interact_06_p1: It's a strange place we call home, the City.
dialogue.explorer_generic_scout_outside_01_p1: I'm keeping my eyes out for anything useful
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_apocalypse_evacua: It seems like we have no other choice but to evacuate the City.
Outside is not an option. We have to do what the Government attempted, but we need to succeed.
Let's collect all the information we can about the Exodus project, so we can find out what went wrong and do better.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_apocalypse_invest: We should investigate sites related to Project Exodus so we can find out more about what went wrong.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_apocalypse_plan_r: I can't believe we are going to leave the City.
Our space shuttle will work better than the Government's.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_apocalypse_quest_: It seems like these earthquakes are threatening the whole City. We have to find a way to stop them.
The Government must have had a plan. Maybe we can find out more about what they knew?
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_apocalypse_space_: Our space ship is ready. It's time to go.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_fall_exodus_01_p1: It seems too much of a coincidence if this Exodus project, whatever exactly it was, just happened to have a launch date scheduled on the date The Fall happened. What were they up to?
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_find_greenhouse_p: If we want the camp to succeed, we need to find herbs.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_rescue_prospector: Sunita said she was going to look for her sister. She's probably somewhere on Level 14.
Sunita said she was going to look for her sister. If she got past Level 14, she's probably trying to get to the Slums near the Surface.
We can't just leave Sunita wandering alone out there. We should go find her. She can't have gotten far.
dialogue.explorer_generic_story_searching_for_gre: We should look for a Greenhouse out in the City.
The only way to stop the disease outbreaks in the camps is to find a way to produce medicine.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_event_01_p1: Hello there. I believe I'm lost, could I stay here for awhile?
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_01_p: The darkness is a terrible place to be alone.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_02_p: I.. don't really remember how I got here. I don't remember the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_03_p: I will make myself useful here in any way I can.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_04_p: Something must have happened to me during or after the Fall that made me lose my memory.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_05_p: I think I lived near the Surface. I remember the sun. The Governor on a screen. But I'm not sure who I was or what I did.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_06_p: It's terrifing being alone in the City, not even sure who you are. You become some kind of an animal.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_07_p: Perhaps I worked with weapons before the Fall? I seem to be quite good at using them.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_08_p: I will protect this community with my life and I expect others to do the same.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_09_p: I remember the Government as a kind of stability and direction.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_10_p: Those who try to rob innocent people out in the City don't deserve your pity.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_11_p: The darkness, if you're in it long enough it's like it's alive. I don't know if the City or some separate entity but.. it feels hostile.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_interact_12_p: I recognized a gang marking the other day. Nobody else here seems to know about it. The Runners. They mostly smuggled things from the Dark Levels.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_outside_02_p1: I get anxious in the dark.
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_outside_03_p1: I won't let anybody hurt you
dialogue.explorer_template_amnesiac_story_apocaly: The thought of going to space is terrifying to be honest. But we conquered the City, perhaps we will conquer it too.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_event_01_p1: I can generally find my way around the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_01_: I'm confident we will build something better this time.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_02_: I used to be an architect. It is strange now to wander here and see all these buildings for myself.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_03_: I think the Government did their best but they had some outdated ideas about City planning.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_04_: Nobody ever considered how transportation between levels would work if the elevators stopped working.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_05_: Do you think we will ever definitely know what caused The Fall?
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_06_: I'm glad people are starting to plan where they build things in the camps a bit.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_07_: Architecture says a lot about the people who built it.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_08_: The first builders of the City were utopists. But then the Dictatorship took over and we got all those bare concrete levels.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_09_: Middle levels of the City have different heights. During the City States period everything was a bit chaotic.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_10_: We will find a way up to the Surface, and find out what happened.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_11_: I cannot believe the Government was ready to abandon its people like this.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_interact_12_: I find myself relying on the spirits more and more. Feels like they were always there, but we just didn't hear.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_meet_01_p1: Well met. Do you have any water by any chance?
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_outside_01_p: The City is like a layer cake of different architectural styles
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_outside_02_p: I feel like some absurd tourist out here sometimes
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_story_apocal: I am sad to have to leave the City. For all its faults, it is a magnificant achievement.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_story_ground: The oldest parts of the City are in the Ground level, which is roughly at sea level. They have been mostly abandoned for a long time now.
dialogue.explorer_template_architect_story_surfac: The Surface refers to the top levels of the City. They were built just a few decades ago.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_event_01_p1: Perhaps you are looking for some help?
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_01_p1: There are so many stories hidden out there in the City, waiting to be discovered.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_02_p1: I love going to abadoned homes and imagining what the people who used to live there were like.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_03_p1: Humans were made to dance and sing and paint and tell stories like beavers were made to build dams.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_04_p1: Sure magic exists. How else would we have built this monster? How else would we even live?
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_05_p1: I was always against the Government. They restricted individual freedoms too much and they had no imagination.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_06_p1: I grew up in the Slums. It was as good place as any, really.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_07_p1: Rituals are stronger to more times you repeat them. People in the Dark Levels hold on to old magic, and it can be very real.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_08_p1: The two most powerful forces in the universe are habits, and imagination.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_09_p1: We are kind of rootless here in the City. We were made to live on the Ground.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_10_p1: We could live a long time like this, just scavenging on the stuff left behind by a society long gone.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_11_p1: I think the Government relied on some magic too. It just pretended it was science.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_interact_12_p1: I hope as we grow this tribe remains like this, where every individual is free and respected.
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_outside_02_p1: I'd like to know more about the people who lived here before the Fall
dialogue.explorer_template_bard_story_apocalypse_: I am excited about going to space.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_event_01_p: I heard you are looking for scavengers.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_interact_0: The City is larger than you can imagine.
The Government thought it ran the City, but it only ran the Surface.
There is old magic on the Ground. I can help you find the way.
In a situation like this, everyone must contribute. Nature suffers no freeloaders.
I have lived by scavening all my life.
It's not power that the Greenhouses need, it's faith.
They called us dark-dwellers because we lived so far down in the City that there wasn't much light. But we're all dark-dwellers now.
History is right here, all around us. We just need to learn to read.
Shall we go explore some more?
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_interact_1: The City is holy because so many people believed in it. We must keep believing.
This plan to evacuate was doomed to fail.
Where ever we go, the spirits will follow.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_interact_d: If I remember right, there's a safe area to the {direction} of here.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_meet_01_p1: I heard you are looking for scavengers.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_outside_02: We don't own the City. We need to be respectful.
dialogue.explorer_template_darkdweller_story_apoc: The City is vast, but it is manmade. What if the space doesn't want us?
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_event_01_p1: I've worked as a guard since before the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_01_p1: The City feels different now. But it's still keeping us all alive.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_02_p1: I worked as a guard at Giga, the mining corporation.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_03_p1: Some people turned into robbers and looters as soon as the Network went down.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_04_p1: I lived periodically in the Dark Levels before the Fall. But it was just inside Giga facilities. I had no idea there was so much abandoned stuff.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_05_p1: The City was built by miners, not governments.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_06_p1: I lived alone, so I only miss my mates at Giga. When you work in a mine together, you become a close-knit group.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_07_p1: We have to stick together in times like this.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_08_p1: Survival of the fittest is never as simple as you think. There's always some luck involved.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_09_p1: These robbers make me angry. Plenty of stuff to scavenge, no need to attack people.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_10_p1: The Government only cared about the Surfacers.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_11_p1: I do miss my old life. But it is what it is.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_interact_12_p1: I did sometimes wonder why the Government wasn't interested in space technology.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_meet_01_p1: Do you have use for a guard?
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_outside_01_p1: If we meet any Giga people, they will help us.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_outside_02_p1: My job is to keep you safe
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_story_expedition: Well I'm glad I didn't join the Surface Expedition after all.
dialogue.explorer_template_guard_story_rescue_abs: I hope Sunita knows what she's doing.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_event_01_p1: Sometimes there's an easier way through if you know how old locks work.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_01_p1: Old keycards still work most of the time. And if you know how, you can make fake ones. Helps opening all kinds of doors.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_02_p1: Even with the Network down, the City keeps some critical infrastructure running. And some of it can be hacked.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_03_p1: I used to spend almost all of my time online.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_04_p1: I'm glad the Government is gone, but who is going to maintain the City in the long run? We need to rebuild before it's too late.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_05_p1: I don't know why you would want to leave the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_06_p1: I've been learning lock-picking. In the lower levels there's all kinds of old models.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_07_p1: I think the Fall could have been caused by a cyber-attack. I knew people who wanted to bring down the Government at any cost.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_08_p1: I think we could get the Network back online before long. It would be amazing to have that without all the Government cencorship.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_09_p1: I think there's a perfectly rational explanation for the so called spirits, we just don't know it.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_10_p1: The Governor was a tyrant but nobody was allowed to criticise him in public.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_11_p1: Old drones are really resilient. They might activate even when you least expect it.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_interact_12_p1: Machines do exactly what we tell them to do. No more, no less.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_meet_01_p1: Sometimes there's an easier way through if you know how old locks work.
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_outside_01_p1: I don't think I fully grasped just how vast the City is before
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_outside_02_p1: Which way do you want to go?
dialogue.explorer_template_hacker_story_apocalyps: I always dreamed of going to space. I just hope we're ready.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_01_p1: I grew up on the Surface, worked in an office. After the Fall I just somehow learned to survive.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_02_p1: I was looking for some place to just start over.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_03_p1: I will fight by your side as long as you will have me.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_04_p1: I survived the Fall together with my fiance. I thought we would escape the City together. But she betrayed me the first chance she got.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_05_p1: Sometimes, I wish this was all just a dream. It feels like a dream. One long, endless night..
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_06_p1: I think this community has what it takes.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_07_p1: I didn't think about the Government much. I was just living my life, minding my own business.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_08_p1: I was on the Surface when the Fall happened. But I was asleep. I woke up and it was just complete chaos. The Sundome was down. A garbage bot guided us to a bunker.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_09_p1: We will traverse the entire City if we need to to find out what happened.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_10_p1: Do you think you could be the next Governor one day?
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_11_p1: I am not sure if I want to see the Surface again. There's only ruins.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_interact_12_p1: The destruction up here is worse than I realised. I don't think I could even find whatever's left of my home.
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_outside_01_p1: If we ever meet my ex, you better do the talking
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_outside_02_p1: How long ago do you think this place was built?
dialogue.explorer_template_lover_story_escape_sta: You decided to stay in the City after all then? I guess the outside is just too dangerous. Part of me wants to see for myself though.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_event_01_p1: I am looking for a place to stay.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_01: I used to work for Futurefields, but I was a researcher rather than farmer.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_02: After the Fall, I decided to try and leave the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_03: I would like to follow along with you and find out what there is outside of the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_04: I survived the Fall just because I happened to be in the lab.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_05: There is an astonishing variety of flora and fauna even in the Dark Levels of the City. The City truly is its own ecosystem.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_06: I wonder if these polluted areas in the City happened before or after the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_07: There were these rituals at Futurefields, related to seed storage and harvest and so on. Of course they were called procedures or something. But they were rituals.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_08: The Ground was even more magical than I ever imagined. It is a shame we never got to see the outside.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_09: Humans are just one animal living in the City.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_10: I think the Government was too focused on technological progress, and somehow lost contact with nature.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_11: I still have nightmares about The Fall.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_interact_12: I had no idea the whole planet was in danger.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_meet_01_p1: I am looking for a place to stay.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_outside_01_: All these ruins gets quite depressing after awhile
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_outside_02_: It looks like they used to have some decorative plants here, but of course they withered as soon as the power went down
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_outside_03_: I can't wait to get out of this place.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_outside_04_: I don't think it was worth it to destroy the rest of the planet to build this behemoth.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_story_apoca: It's quite impressive that the Govenrment managed to keep all this space technology mostly secret.
dialogue.explorer_template_researcher_story_groun: I am so excited we found the Ground. It's beautiful!

Do you think you can just pick a direction on the Ground, and keep walking, and eventually come out of the City? Or do you think the old gates that kept all those climate refugees out also keep us in?
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_03_p1: Today is the first of N9, year 783. It is the first day of Bustle.
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_04_p1: I am currently not able to connect to the Network for weather information.
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_05_p1: I will see to it immediately.
dialogue.explorer_template_servo_interact_06_p1: I hope you have a wonderful day.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_event_01_p1: I'm alone, can I please stay here?
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_01_p1: I don't know what happened to my family.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_02_p1: It's amazing what you can find if you look.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_03_p1: I'm so happy I found a place to stay. It was scary to go alone.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_04_p1: I never knew there were so many Levels.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_06_p1: I know it wasn't pretty after the Fall. I just.. ran away I guess.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_07_p1: One time I found this action figurine of an old series I from the 60s that I like for some reason. It's my lucky charm.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_09_p1: Do you think the earthquakes are getting worse?
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_10_p1: I think someone should build an amusement park. It would be a huge success.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_11_p1: Thanks for taking me with you.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_interact_12_p1: I'm not scared. I know we can figure this out. We figured everything else out.
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_outside_01_p1: I'm collecting magnets just for fun. I found one with the Dictator!
dialogue.explorer_template_teen_outside_02_p1: Let me know if I can help carry anything!
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_event_01_p1: You look like someone who could use a bodyguard.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_00_p1: It's best not to travel alone. It's pretty lawless out here since the Fall.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_01_p1: Everyone is just trying to get by the best they can.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_02_p1: Weird quesiton, do you believe in ghosts?
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_03_p1: Before the Fall? Oh, you know. I did some odd jobs. All over the place, really.
dialogue.explorer_unique_gambler_interact_04_p1: I don't like being alone in the Dark Levels. I keep seeing things there in the shadows.
